name: obliterative

An obliterative disease or treatment is one in which a part of the body becomes blocked, has disappeared, or is removed: Obliterative bronchiolitis is a rare disease in which the airways of the lungs become blocked. They performed obliterative surgery on the patient.
More examplesFewer examplesChemotherapy followed by an obliterative surgical approach is a good option for treating this kind of cancer.They used obliterative laser therapy to treat the growths.Obliterative endarteritis is the severe inflammation of an artery, leading to it becoming blocked.
